controls.title: Ensure iptables packages are installed
controls.description: iptables is a utility program that allows a system administrator to configure the tables provided by the Linux kernel firewall.
controls.rationale: A method of configuring and maintaining firewall rules is necessary to configure a Host Based Firewall.
controls.audit:
Run the following command to verify iptables is installed:
# rpm -q iptables iptables-services
iptables-<version>
iptables-services-<version>
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to install iptables and iptables-services:
# dnf install iptables iptables-services
controls.cis_controls:
v8: 4.4 Implement and Manage a Firewall on Servers
v7: 9.4 Apply Host-based Firewalls or Port Filtering

controls.title: Ensure nftables is not installed with iptables
controls.description: nftables is a subsystem of the Linux kernel providing filtering and classification of network packets.
controls.rationale: Running both iptables and nftables may lead to conflict.
controls.audit:
Run the following command to verify nftables is not installed:
# rpm -q nftables
package nftables is not installed
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to remove nftables:
# dnf remove nftables
controls.cis_controls:
v8: 4.4 Implement and Manage a Firewall on Servers
v7: 9.4 Apply Host-based Firewalls or Port Filtering

controls.title: Ensure firewalld is not installed with iptables
controls.description: firewalld is a firewall management tool for Linux operating systems.
controls.rationale: Running both firewalld and iptables may lead to conflict.
controls.audit:
Run the following command to verify firewalld is not installed:
# rpm -q firewalld
package firewalld is not installed
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to remove firewalld:
# dnf remove firewalld
